Of course, for some reason it is not free at most high end hotels so who can blame them. Conclusion: in my humble opinion, this is definitely a 4 star hotel worthy of its going rate. If I return to Seattle I will only stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: Sacramento_CADave
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights with our 2 young kids. The hotel is very clean and modern. Great downtown location within walking distance to most sites. The staff was friendly and helpful. Only negative was there was no bathtub in the room, only a shower, which made bathing our youngest difficult. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “State of the Art...in the Heart of Seattle...with awesome indoor lap pool!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannieloveslife
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, newer hotel in downtown Seattle. Exceptional service from the concierge and registration staff. Heated, indoor pool, ~65 ft length, great for swimming laps, extensive gym as well. Very clean room and reasonably priced. Visited the Space Needle, Aquarium, Pike's Market and numerous restaurants....all within comfortable walking distance from this wonderful hotel situated in the heart of Seattle. We would stay here again in a heartbeat! Four days in Seattle, residing at the Hyatt at Olive 8, was the perfect prelude to our Alaskan cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel with fab views”
Reviews.Author: Sdvcooper
Reviews.Content: Although about 2 years old this hotel retains it's ultra new and modern feel. On arrival by car, even the valet parking area under the "concrete" domed canopy is impressive. The lobby is light airy and modern with a high ceiling and suspended pendant lights, the staff are efficient and helpful. The room we had had views over the city and was large (standard room) clean and modern. The bathroom was very clean and modern, but the shower unfortunately was hopeless and had very weak pressure alternating hot and cold. WiFi was very expensive here - about $30 for 3 days so we made use of the countless Starbucks coffee shops in the city - including the worlds first! The valet parking was also expensive, but for us unavoidable, I also found it slow to recall the car, so it might be worth calling down with advance notice if you need to go anywhere with the car. The most impressive feature about this hotel is the concierge, I have never come across such a fantastic concierge service anywhere in the world - well worth a chat to these guys. In summary, A very nice hotel, but I think WiFi needs to be free, and parking charges cut.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel in a Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: chadrach3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 15th anniversary in Seattle and this hotel was great. The decor is super trendy, which was fun, but not really a big deal for us. We loved the super quick check-in at the kiosk, because you never really know if you're going to have a friendly employee or not. The room was large and very nice. We had a view of the Paramount which was fun watching people flock to see Mary Poppins. We had drinks in the bar, and the waitresses were very friendly. We walked all over downtown, shopping, eating and sightseeing, and to be able to come right back to the hotel was wonderful. The valet guys had our car ready in minutes. And although parking is crazy expensive, it is, afterall, Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: markichaus
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel in Seattle, right around the corner from another Hyatt. It's a very green hotel winning an award for it's use of green and sustainable building. The rooms are very modern. The bathroom has a very nice European style shower with a glass enclosure. The desk is very nice and sleek with a TV you can hook your laptop into. It was a very nice and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE!!”
Reviews.Author: Lilsquirrel
Reviews.Content: We love a nice short weekend trip to get away from it all, and the Hyatt at Olive 8 is a great place if your destination is downtown Seattle. It is a very new hotel, and were fortunate enough to try it after winning it on a bidding website (the price was still above average, but this was a crazy weekend in Seattle where barely anything could be found for under $300/night, and this is an above average hotel). Worth the splurge, and we felt we got our money's worth. If only our stay was longer, but there's always next time. A true pleasant surprise. We were welcomed upon check in with a map of the area (nice gesture), and we arrived in our room to be wowed by such a nice room we wished our stay was longer. The location was next to none, right next to Pacific Place (a shopper's paradise), and only a short walk from everything else downtown Seattle has to offer. We had previously stayed at the Westin, and this is a much nicer hotel by a long stretch. The bathroom was so nice and modern, and we loved the shower (no tub--which we actually loved). They even had my favourite toothpaste!!! Love the space saving, modern sliding glass door (wish we could do that in our condo back home!) They have free wifi in the lobby, and we wished we had a chance to try Urbane, which was always bustling. We wished we had the time to try the steam room/pool, but there was so much to do (Seattle has so many nice restaurants--try the Ponti Seafood Grill--a drive away in the University district, or walk to the Hunt Club in the old Sorrento Hotel for the $30 prime rib special). Would be back in a heartbeat! TIP: If you are on a budget you can self-park overnight in Pacific Place (2 blocks away). It was very secure, and even though the overnight rate is $28/night we lucked out and only paid $11 and we entered before the 5pm!) The people in the parkade were a bit confusing, but I think it was a summer parking special. The rate is cheaper if you enter after 5pm I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: NC_Rambler
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Olive 8 is fantastic! I really appreciated the contemporary styling throughout. I also ejoyed the pool and spa, which is available to all the hotel guests. This is THE place to stay in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt at Olive 8 made for a fantastic Valentine...!”
Reviews.Author: GT_Dubu
Reviews.Content: This occasion was an evening getaway for Valentine's for myself and significant other. The biggest draw was the spa and definitely was not disappointed. Reserved a deluxe king room with a fabulous view of Seattle skyline, clean fresh rooms with comfortable bed and a large well apointed bath and luxurious shower. Spa treatment selected was a 60 minute couples massage in a quiet private room with a very relaxing ambiance, this and the wonderful dinner after might the night very special.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: passportwilltravel
Reviews.Content: Truly splendid location, and the minimalist ambiance, as well as the LEED cert was intellectually interesting. We found ourselves studying everything as we utilized the hotel features. The first night we were a family of 2 in one room, and the second night we added the nextdoor room for two more. Our location looking back towards the downslope enabled us to get great sunshine and overlook a patio. The Good? The personnel in the hotel truly performed, so accomodating. We were scattered about town at the moment of departure, needing to get to the port, and the bellboys called and detained a very reasonably priced limo for us. I had inadvertently left a fancy phone charger in the room, and since it had already been swept by housekeeping but not turned in, the front desk tracked it down for me lickety-split so that we could finally make our way to Pier 66. Hooray for excellent hotel staff! The Bad? Either very thin walls, or the gap at the hallway doors is too tall and the noise attenuation is insufficient. Party hearty types on the one side left us tossing and turning until 3 am (even though the neighbors weren't exceedingly raucous), and then the babies on the other side started their early morning shift of noisemaking at who knows what hour? Also, it would be fabulous if they would actually velcro tape the edge of the curtains which meet the wall. Each morning a shaft of glorious Seattle light would fall directly over the pillows across the two beds. Perfect alignment for no shut-eye in the am! If you are a deep sleeper or wear earplugs and eye masks, this is a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, new hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cksdcalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights this past June. It is a new eco friendly hotel. The rooms had great amenities such as a mini fridge and coffee maker. The only down side to the room is the barn slider doors in the bathroom. As they don't "close" like a regular door, you do get some residual noise from the shower in the room. Service throughout the hotel was excellent and the location is excellent. It was a 10 minute walk to the market and the large shopping center was just down the block.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location for downtown visit.”
Reviews.Author: iamjvn
Reviews.Content: I found a better rate of $130 on priceline and was assigned this hotel. The hotel is great. The rooms are exactly what we wanted; very clean, excellent bathrooms (even if they only have a shower, no bath), very well decorated. My dad stayed in the room next door, and was also very happy. Great beds. I like that the hotel does not change towels just for the hell of it, you have to request a change. The breakfast was excellent. I had the almond-crusted french toast, twice. Self-parking was around the corner, not part of the hotel, and we payed just over $56 from Friday night to Sunday morning. We did not need a car while in Seattle downtown. Reception was perfect, no line-up, which helps. Guests services guy gave us a map of Seattle, quick and easy. Essentially when staying at a hotel you don't want things to go wrong. Nothing did.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel but nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: SeekingSunBC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night in a King room on the15th floor. We had booked the amour package through the Hyatt website that included breakfast, valet parking, turndown service and champagne & strawberries (it was supposed to include bath salts but given that there was no tub in our room their ommission was not missed). The front desk staff were friendly and professional, and the lobby while small was adequate with 2 different seating areas but there were dirty glasses that sat there unattended for at least 1/2 hour. Our room was an average size and modernly furnished in dark woods and brown, white and teal fabrics. The bed was okay (not as premium as at home but still comfortable) - the downside was no king size pillows only regular size so that was a little difficult to adjust to. The empty fridge was a welcome addition to the room and the 1 cup coffee maker was great (but be aware that it doesn't come with directions so its a little tricky if you aren't familiar with the disks). Water is available in the room for $4 a bottle. There is an ipod docking station on the clock radio - just remember to dim the light or its very bright in the middle of the night. There's a gap under the entrance door that makes noise from the hallway filter in or out as we found out from the neighbours ;) it also allows the light to filter in. the bathroom was quite large with a walk in shower - we had no issue with water pressure but it did take a while for it to warm up each time we used it. Only one robe in the room was strange and only 2 bath towels which was fine since we had turndown service but not so great if you didn't. We ate at Urbane and the food was good, the coffee was probably prepared with a french press since we both landed up with grounds in the bottom of our cups but the service was barely acceptable...in 45 minutes we were offered one cup of coffee and when I requested a refill in a clean cup it took a while to come and we never got asked again. We had ordered extra bacon and had a separate bill for that which we left $15 for to include a tip ($5.50 for the bacon, $9.50 for a tip) but when we checked out the waitress had charged it to the room even after I had said that the cash was for tip & extra bacon - the front desk removed the charge but it was very frustrating after the lack of service to then have to deal with this. I didn't like the view from the restaurant... all of the hotels smokers gathering on the corner for a few puffs followed by the requests from the bus stop patrons for cigarettes from the smokers...not very appetizing The pool looked nice and was empty at 11 am when we checked it out but we didn't use it. One last thing that was undoubtedly an isolated thing but there were several drops of blood on the elevator floor when we went down for breakfast and when we used the same elevator to check out at closer to 2 they were still there. We used the conceige for our dinner reservations and he suggested Ivar's rather than Elliots. I'm not sure it was the best location for our anniversary dinner given the number of people in shorts and beach coverups or the large number of families but the salmon was excellent. Overall I'd say we might return for the right price but definately not for what we paid. the rooms were clean and comfortable but it lacked the warmth that we've always felt at the Sheraton or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to vacation”
Reviews.Author: briankerrick
Reviews.Content: Not a single complaint from our weekend stay at the Hyatt at Olive 8. 2nd floor salt-water pool, Jacuzzi and sauna were great; the room was beautiful and was luxurious in every sense of the word. Loved the tv's embedded in the mirrors and large windows overlooking the city. Will definitely be back. When you stay, I recommend the Amour package which came with a room delivery of champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries after we checked in and a free breakfast at their Urbane restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice If Not Very Special”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite (it was not an upgrade), for a weekend. It's a very big room (living room + bedroom + double closets + 1 1/2 bathrooms) but was lacking in any warmth or charm. What I liked was the abundance of HD TV programming and space. Drawbacks included the low water pressure, air conditioning that was dependent on a motion sensor (so it kept going off at night), and WiFi for a fee ($10). More generally, the fitness center is great -- large and with lots of new equipment. And, while pricey, the food and service in the hotel's restaurant, Urbane, were both excellent. I also found all of the hotel staff I encountered to be very friendly and committed to making things right. I certainly wouldn't mind returning here but wouldn't insist on it either.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST POSSIBLE EXPERIENCE . . .”
Reviews.Author: 25dreamer
Reviews.Content: I just had the pleasure of staying at the Hyatt at Olive 8 and it was the best possible experience. The concierge staff was outstanding. The concierge staff's restaurant recommendations proved to be "fantastic". I did not encounter any staff member who was not friendly and accommodating. The hotel room was spotless, the view was fantastic. I do have one comment, there was no full length mirror in the room, but when it was mentioned to a staff member, one was brought to the room. It was explained that the hotel had not finished adding them to all the rooms. The staff made my stay the best possible experience I've had at a hotel in a while. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grava83
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great room, perfect location, great friendly staff. Amazing restaurant in the hotel, wonderful breakfast grea tlunch. Just perfect trip all together. Recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: vangrizz
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Olive 8 a few times, and it seems to get that little bit better each time. This time we were staying for two nights to celebrate our anniversary (although we were on our way back from Orlando, so we had our kids with us. How romantic is that?) and to go see Aladdin at the 5th Avenue Theatre. Arrival was good, and though I wish they had a self-park option, the valet is always prompt and friendly. I've never had to wait more than a minute to get checked in at this hotel, and this time was the same. We were given a corner room with two queen beds, the extra space being appreciated since we were traveling with our children. The room itself was great with a view out the front towards the Paramount Theatre, but the windows along the side of the building looked into the office building right beside. We generally just kept those drapes closed, but the kids did have some fun pointing out people who were on u-tube during work hours. There's two things that make this THE hotel for me when I'm in Seattle. One is the location, as it's a very short walk to pretty much anywhere from here. The other is their restaurant Urbane. This is one of the best places for breakfast that I've found, and while I'd usually prefer to sleep over getting up for breakfast, I never miss a chance to have the Seattle Omelet here. Check out was a breeze. I appreciated Liam taking the time to explain to me how point redemption worked from the hotels side of things. Very interesting. Can't wait to get back here, just need another reason to spend a night in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with amazing views.”
Reviews.Author: TySki
Reviews.Content: From all the reviews and research I did on this place, it met every expectation of a fantastic hotel, except the rooms. Location, service, views, food, pool/workout room were all top-notch. However, I would rate the rooms a little above average, but not for the price. Initially, I walked in and loved it. The colors were great and there was plenty of room.. but everything felt a little fake to me. All the wood had the appearance of being a little fake and cheap.. The shower had only one setting which was pretty strong, and didn't make my sun-burn feel great (haha), the wall in our room had huge black marks all over it, and of course.. no free internet. The views and beds were great though.. which is the most important thing to me. I thought I would just share my thoughts about the bad so people would know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel and nice stay”
Reviews.Author: newyorker88
Reviews.Content: This is a modern, green, hotel pretty much in the center of the downtown district. Room was modern and comfortable. We had a great stay. Pluses: Modern good location great pool Negatives: short hours of concierge low shower pressure (this is because it is a green hotel and not a big deal). We had a fine stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice inside and short walk to convention center, but needs soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: Devon11
Reviews.Content: Appears to be newly remodeled. Clean. Indoor pool divided into 3 lap lanes and a hot tub. One cup coffee maker in room. A few blocks to Convention Center. Close to monorail. Staff was very helpful in getting me packages that I had shipped there. Big con for me: Paper thin walls and a lot of noise can be heard from the hallway. The elevator has a loud "ding" when it comes to a floor. Although I was not right near the elevators, I could hear it. I have to give it 3 stars because of the noise. Other cons: Elevator can be slow at times. Really need some new pillows for the beds--not much stuffing in them at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff. Great Rooms. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: trish72
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to compare this Hyatt to the Grand Hyatt, because we checked in here the day we checked out of the Grand. Just like the Grand, I have nothing but good things to say about this place. As the name says, it is on Olive and 8 so it is about 1/2 a block away from the Grand. It is very much centrally located, which made it easy to walk everywhere- Belltown, Pioneeer Square, Pike Place, etc. I do have to say that while I prefer the rooms at the Grand Hyatt, the rooms here are also amazing. The room we got may have been smaller than the one we got at the Grand, but everything is still top-notch. Everything - furniture, fixtures, fittings, electronics, etc - is very clean and modern; the bathroom is nice and spacious (although smaller than the one at the Grand and only had a shower/tub combo); and the bed is heavenly comfortable. I will say, though, that the staff here seemed a lot friendlier and accommodating than those at the Grand (I never thought the service could be surpassed there, but I guess I was wrong). Despite the fact that we made our booking through Priceline, our riff-raff status did not seem to matter to the staff because we were treated so very well and were made to feel truly welcome and appreciated as guests. The service provided by everyone - from front desk to housekeeping to the bar staff - was just impeccable. Just to niggle at a couple of things because that is what I do: in-room wifi is not free, which bugs me in this day and age, and parking is expensive ($38, valet only, but on par with what is offered in the area, and one can always self-park at the 7th and Pike Garage for $30/24 hours). Still, Hyatt at Olive 8 gets a 4.5* rating from me, which I will round up to a 5 because of the AMAZING staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: lsasource
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to everything. And one block from the subway made it easy to get to Pioneer Square. The staff was accomodating and friendly. Would recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to seattle”
Reviews.Author: Marik81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of friends for the 4th of july weekend. The location of the hotel is perfect it's located near shopping center, market, and most of the other attractions! The hotel is clean, the rooms are nice the pool and spa are great! We also enjoyed the restaurant and the bar at the hotel called urbane we ate breakfast there every day and each day it was very good! The bar is also nice the the girl that runs it is very nice and very helpful! There is also a nice coffee bar there which has amazing mochas! Oveall I would recommend this hotel to everyone and would stay there again! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: majorh
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at this hotel while on vacation,with my son. The hotel staff was extremely courteous and helpful. After being gone for most of the day, it was quite refreshing to come and enjoy the pool to relax. Also, i was able to take advantage of the equipment in the gym. The only negative experience was on one morning,while eating breakfast at Urbane,they kept getting our order wrong. Overall, we had a pleasant experience while staying there and would probably stay there when visiting Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Average”
Reviews.Author: tvegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a deluxe room. Good - *Comfortable bed. *Clean. Housekeeping was of a high standard. *The gym was great - several running and eliptical machines, many free weights and fixed machines. Also a super salt water pool (non-chlorinated). *Front desk staff seemed genuine and friendly. Although the concierge desk was always very busy for the one member of staff in attendance. SoSo- *The noise of banging of doors all along the corridor got rather annoying fairly early on, there are large gaps on the bottom of the room doors, which I think could be improved on for better sound insulation. *A little mean on towel allowance, but housekeeping happy to leave more as desired. *The room decor is clean and functional. Not luxurious. *By the television there is a tv interface console which is meant to make plugging in other devices to show on the tv easy - it did not work. The hotel engineer on the telephone could not assist us either. Bad - *Shower pressure was dubious - maybe it is only on the higher floors, but you had to literally move around to get wet. The flow was feeble and pulsatile. Not good enough for a 4 star property. *Paying for the internet - a cheap practice for a big hotel chain in the year 2011. An average hotel with some nice features. I would stay somewhere else on returning to Seattle for there are many other good properties in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Their service took it from Average to Excellent”
Reviews.Author: EagleDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night after our cruise to Alaska with our family - wife and 2 kids. The hotel is top of the line. We booked a deluxe room which was a corner room with 2 beds. The rooms was huge and had lots of windows for natural light. The pool area is very nice with nice furnshings. The changing room is part of the spa so you have access to saunas, showers, etc. The hotel is very eco-friendly which is a nice touch if you care about those things. The location is great and only a couple of blocks from the convention center, shopping and Pike's market. As the title said, their service is what set them apart. When we returned later in the evening from the Mariner's baseball game I asked the front desk about transportation to the airport for the next morning since we did not fit into one taxi with all our luggage. Yes, I could have made the arrangements early, but didn't. When I inquired at the front desk they told me there was no way to guarantee a van. I found this odd as most high end hotels have contracts with a car service. After going a few rounds with the front desk they simply told me that the night manager would start calling a cab company at 6 am for our 6:40 am departure and if we were lucky they could find something. Making our way to the lobby at 6:30 I was not expecting what I was greeted with. When the elevator doors opened there stood the night manager (like he knew we were coming) "Mr. X? I have arranged for a private van to pick you up and it will be here in 10 minutes - is there anything else I can help you with?" Now that is what I call service and they will have my business again. While the price is on the upper end - you will find this hotel to be a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent but not fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsilver212
Reviews.Content: Centrally located for shopping and dining, this green hotel has beautiful rooms and great room service. On the downside, the bed was not firm enough for my bad back, towels were flimsy, the television did not have the station I wanted (MSNBC) and they charge ten dollars per day for wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: marcmrrs
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in this hotel. Hotel was fantastic rooms were clean and roomy, beds were very comfortable bathroom was great big shower room. The spa facilities are great too, location of the hotel for Seattle was great for everything. Only down side expensive car parking and you have to pay for wifi which in this day and age when staying in a hotel wifi should be free.I would stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations but probably won't there stay again”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaChopsticks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at downtown Seattle for just the last night of our trip. I had visited Seattle before and stayed at the Grand Hyatt a few years ago. The Hyatt at Olive 8 is obviously designed to be a modern and hip hotel but more "accessible" to the public. I thought the lobby was quite bare. Room was nicely appointed except the following: 1) room noise - the door/lock system was fairly noisy (or may be because the walls were thin). Every time someone opens/closes the door you hear a loud click and bang. You can also hear faint traffic noise from the main street. 2) we only had a Queen size bed (I would not pay $280++ for a Queen size for two). 3) shower/faucet had very low flow of water. No bath tub in our room. This hotel is a green hotel but personally I like the option of taking a bath. 4) The duvet felt cheap - reminds me of a Courtyard hotel where you just get a bed sheet as duvet. They had a back up blanket (cotton) in the closet. As a Hyatt hotel and sleeping in cool weather, Iâ€™d expect they at least have a down duvet or wool blanket. Valet parking was $40 a night which I guess is expected at any major city. Service of the hotel was good. Too bad we didn't use the spa/pool sounds like there are a lot of positive reviews. The highlight of our stay was our breakfast. Restaurant was busy but food came out quickly. Definitely the best French Toast I've had. My husband had an omelet which was very good. Coffee was excellent as expected. Would definitely return for the restaurant but not to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: JC_NorthVan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the hotels in the vicinity - Paramount, Hotel Max, Mayflower. Hyatt is a little more expensive but it was worth it. I bought the advance purchase rate which made this affordable for me. Really liked the newness of the building. The pool and spa is awesome. Great location for shopping in downtown Seattle. Also Whole Foods was about 7 blocks away so easy to pick up food if you are on a strict diet and can't fine dine.... can't comment on the restaurants, as I didn't eat at them. You can't open the windows in the room but this made the room extremely quiet when sleeping and the ventilation was good. Normally I can't stand it when I can't open the window but I felt fine with the air quality. Good mattresses. Have a great sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover77_5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights in June 2011 and I loved this hotel. It has the best pool/ health club I have ever seen, which made me love it so much (the pool is huge and the steam room, sauna, jacuzzi etc. are awesome). The room is decorated in a modern/minimalist style, but it is nothing extraordinary. I actually did not like the frosted glass bathroom door because it did not isolate the noise at all (my 2-year old daughter would wake up every time I used the bathroom and every time i opened and closed the door) so I consider it the major defect of the room. I also noticed dust and a nut under the nightstand a few minutes after we entered the room the first time, although they would clean the room quite well every day. The marble shower is really nice, despite the environmentally friendly feature (lower water pressure than normal). The room was really quiet, which was critical for me to have a good night sleep. We booked a couple of tours through the concierge and he was very helpful but slow. Overall, I found all the other services at the hotel (room service, taxi service, bell-man) to be impeccable. Any request you make by phone is immediately solved. We had a lovely stay overall and I would definitely stay here again next time I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, modern, eco-friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: curiousjayu
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a brief vacation before a work-related conference. Overall, this is an excellent hotel. The room was well appointed and very clean. (One thing we did notice off the bat is that the rooms seem a tad bit narrow - but they're pretty long, so that makes up for it.) The bathroom is nice, but there was only a stand-up shower. Still, plenty of room. The bed was comfortable and the housekeeping service was great. And, the hotel gym is the BEST I've ever seen at a hotel. One downside is that they charge for internet access. The concierge was helpful but there is not really a business center. The location is good - walkable to Pike Place Market and shopping, and not too far from other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, perfect and honest hotel”
Reviews.Author: tkdmom
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three traveling to Seattle last summer for a couple of days prior to our cruise to Alaska. This is probably one of most favorite place we've ever visited. Seattle is a wonderful city with so much diversity. We choose this hotel based on the location and that was a "green hotel". First, the room was large, clean and the view was a really nice city view. We ate the hotel restaurant the first night as we were pretty jet lagged coming from South Florida. The food was ok, and pricey. We are simple eaters and it was just a bit too fancy for us, but the ambience was very nice. We found a Cheesecake Factory around the corner which was more our style, especially with a pickey eater of a teenager. There is a great place for breakfast around the corner as well, in an Asian restuarant that serves sushi..I can't remember the name of it but it was really good food for breakfast and reasonable price. The server there was wonderful. Pikes Market was a few minutes walk and we took public transportation to visit the Space Needle. We purchased a pair of expensive (Mount St. Helen) earrings and by accident I left it in the hotel room after we checked out going to our cruise. Mid week through the cruise, I realized what happened and from Alaska, I called the hotel and put a lost and found request in. I didn't think I would ever hear back. But I did. The earrings were found and they mailed it back and I received them about ten days later. It's wonderful to know that honesty still remains especially coming from a large chain hotel. This hotel had plenty of amenities, but we didn't have much time to use them, but their guest services and room service people are honest and that alone is a great reason to stay here. This is a beautiful hotel. We would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Calio
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. We had a city view room although to be honest the view itself was nothing to write home about but we were high up and it was quiet so we were quite happy. The room itself was lovely, nicely decorated and comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful. Other reviewers were right about the shower pressure but that was no big deal. The staff here were all very helpful and friendly. Downtown Seattle isn't huge so any hotel in 'downtown' isn't far from the action and the Hyatt was no exception. If we were back in Seattle we would be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrahamEssex
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night in transit to a cruise but what a lovely hotel.Rooms were beuatiful spacious and clean and very quiet. Free wi fi is available. Nice restaurant attached for a quick meal and situated ideally fror a short trip to the cruise terminal . Check out Pike Market just down the road for beautiful flowre and fish market

Reviews.Title: “the best of seattle”
Reviews.Author: MsNancy10
Reviews.Content: I travel for work about 20 weeks out of the year and stay at different hotels around the world. The Hyatt at Olive 8 is my all time favorite for business for several reasons. The rooms are always clean and the design is fantastic (large vanity, outlets, desk layout etc), the hotel restaurant is good which means you don't have to worry about gross unhealthy room service unlike other hotel chains. The location is great for getting around on foot or by car and the service is amazing. Last but not least the gym! I could spend hours in there which is nearly impossible to say at other hotel gyms. love love love this place. Hope the prices stay reasonable because I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great city-center hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yoram2HerzliaIsrael
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel with new facilities and modern amenities inside and outside of your room. The 20 meter swimming pool is the best hotel pool we ever enjoyed. So is the Gym. The staff is very attentive to all your needs and the concierge knowledgeable and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, trendy and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: polartravel
Reviews.Content: One of the better Hyatt Hotels, trendy with a distinctively "green" touch, nice and modern rooms, very good breakfast, friendly service, and a superb swimming pool. The location is central yet quiet (as long as you choose one of the upper floor rooms). As others mentioned, the (inexpensive) airport train stops just a few blocks from the hotel. All in all a very good stay for a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: TeamPA
Reviews.Content: Courtesy of employees really stood out - very nice people. Basic room was nice, large and comfortable (green hotel). Would like to have had a couch or more comfortable chair in the room. Lobby is modern with a bar/restaurant and sitting area, nothing major - clean. Located just a couple of blocks from all of the tourist attractions. Cabs are plentiful and actually enjoyable experience. Hotel has a spa and pool. Did not eat there. Would stay again even though they didnt have a business center.

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing..would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: mithcell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there 5 mights. Room was very retro and very nice. What impressed us most was the exercise room...fantastic! Staff was friendly and prices surprisingly affordable.

Reviews.Title: “FANCY AND NICE BUT BEWARE THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: haringdr27
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel of our vacation in Seattle. The location is good. Walk to Pikes Market, about 20 minutes. A block from the high end mall and shops. Cheesecake factory was around the corner. The room was Hyatt quality, really comfortable bed and they supply you with everything you need. Very Comfortable and what you expect from Hyatt. My only issues: A cooler they called a refrigerator didn't work and our food spoiled but they sent up milk at no cost for cereal we brought. The parking was ridiculously overpriced, about $40.00 per day, the lot across the street was $25.00. They make you pay for internet which I find absurd. At these rates it should be complimentary like most hotels. Even low end hotels offer free wifi, no excuse they make you pay other then another way to gouge the guest for that extra buck. Last complaint was the salt water pool which was heated to 80' was cold. Only little kids were in and we lasted about 5 minutes, it was way to cold. Overall, I recommend this hotel if your a business traveler or have money to burn. After all this is a Hyatt so you know it's going to be expensive. As for traveling here with a 1 year old child, not recommended since cheaper hotels offer the same amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location next to public transport link to airport.”
Reviews.Author: Alimmin
Reviews.Content: As one of Hyatt property you can depend on the reputation of a good and well maintain property. The lobby has a modern-zen like quality. I would describe the guest experience as "strictly business" as it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Five nights and we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Morandi2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Olive 8 for 5 nights in May. We upgraded to the hypoallergenic floor (and extra $25.00 per night) and I must say, it was worth it. Very, very clean, I dont think there many people on our floor so it was very quiet, no door slamming in the middle of the night! Our package included breakfast and it was delicious, lots of choices. The only weird thing was there was no bathtub in the huge bathroom. It was a great stay and we would definatley go back there. It also has the biggest pool and no one was ever in it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ... mediocre service... watch your wallet”
Reviews.Author: Craigeryvr
Reviews.Content: First off, if you like trendy, new hotels, the decor and furnishing at the Hyatt are great. Also great fitness centre. The service however leaves much to be desired. I booked this hotel on a discount website for a weekend, paying half rack rate. The staff were unenthusiatic and the checkin experience alone gave me the impression the Hyatt was more interested in trying to extract every dime from me than providing helpful service. Checking in at 4, I was told me room was not ready but for only another $25 a night I could have an allegry friendly room (which just has an air filter in it) or leave and come back later. I came back an hour back later, and was given the same room that they had tried to upsell me before. If my booked class of room is not available, most other hotels give a free upgrade instead of trying to upsell you or make you wander the city for an hour. The parking is horrendously expensive,$41 per day for valet ($50 with taxes and tips) and when I asked about cheaper options I was told that there was a self park a block away for $28 /day but nothing else and that it would likely end up cheaper to use the valet service. Fortunately a local tipped me off that street parking from 6 pm Sat to 8 am Monday is free in Seattle. It was dissapointing that I specifically asked about cheaper parking and was not told about free street parking on the weekend, closer to the hotel than the safe park. Between the room "upgrade" which they tried to get me to buy and didn't, and pushing me to use valet service and not telling about the free street parking, in my first few minutes they tried to get me to spend another $150, close to the cost of my 2 night booking. There was no effort on the part of staff to explain the ammenties or help me with my luggage and generally more interested in talking to themselves than providing prompt service. The comparable hotel chain that I normally stay at gives me free parking, free internet, free bottled water, free upgrades when rooms aren't availble. The Hyatt: $4 bottles of water, $15 internet charges, no paper. Maybe upselling and not telling guests about free parking are part of the corporate culture or maybe I got second rate service because I used a vocher from a discount website. It's a nice hotel for style, just don't expect to be treated as a valued guest.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel pool for lap swimming”
Reviews.Author: tw0thirds
Reviews.Content: I worked in Seattle for two+ months and stayed in 3-4 different hotels in the downtown area. This is by far my favorite hotel. It is clean, modern and has a great pool for lap swimming. The pool is probably why I like the hotel so much. You can actually do real lap swimming! The pool is 3-lanes and ~23 yards long. It is also not too hot at ~80 degrees. (Many leisure pools are too hot for real swimming.) The only thing missing is a pace clock. The rooms are modern, clean and quiet. I have never had noise issues at this hotel nor have I had to break out the ear plugs. My only dislike about the room is the shower. Since the shower is not fully enclosed, it can get a bit chilly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BellaGirl47
Reviews.Content: Very cool and hip hotel, fabulous restaurant, nice staff. The walls are a tad thin, so you can hear others when in the bathroom, but didn't interfere with our sleep. Wonderful pool and spa area, very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel, fantastic pool”
Reviews.Author: carolina2323
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a night while visiting Seattle. The room was so clean and pretty and the bed was by far the best part of the room. We went swimming and in the steam room and very much enjoyed the pool/fitness area. Only downfall to the hotel was the shower pressure, we were on the 17th floor so maybe that made it worse. Oh also, Urbane for drinks is very convenient and elegant.

Reviews.Title: “We'd definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: grandmumirene
Reviews.Content: New, clean, modern, elegantly designed, comfortable, well located - and building is LEED certified. Slept well - room well insulated from any street noise. Lovely salt water pool and spa. Staff helpful and professional. Our family went down to the pool one evening, ready to swim, and found that it was closed for a private function. There had been no signs or notices about this. They made it up to us with a free movie and and tray of milk and freshly baked cookies. Very nice! One negative was that WiFi costs an extra $10 per day - we went down the street to Starbucks for breakfast instead of using their coffee shop, which was pretty quiet and closes at 11am. However, the hotel restaurant, Urbane, is great and serves local produce. Parking is breathtakingly expensive, but there are other lots nearby. You can't go wrong at this restaurant or at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - service a little off”
Reviews.Author: Richellee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the only LEED certified in Seattle, which is awesome! Nice hotel, great location, nice rooms. The rooms are modern and the desk is nice and big, flat screen TV, ample room, big beautiful bathroom. The maid just came and she didn't even clean up my wine glass or take the used glasses from yesterday. She also didn't remake the bed fully (the colorful pillows weren't replaced and are laying on the shelf under the TV, messy). She didn't replace our used cups didn't even clean the washroom. Quite shocking. Also, a man came to pick up the tray from room service which was delivered yesterday. He knocked and before I took two steps he pranced in - sooo violating and rude. We didn't have the tray anyway, as we gave it back to the delivery person at the time. Check-in staff and the concierge were great. The restaurant downstairs had a yummy breakfast and the service staff there were also nice. Very cold restaurant. Not sure why they had the AC blasting in cold Seattle. The bed is hard. The room is surprisingly quiet, also very dark at night which is nice. If it wasn't for the poor housekeeping and the service man who came in unannounced (I could have been NAKED), I would have rated this hotel 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: chrissyliz1210
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights in April. It's really a nice hotel. It beautiful and clean and the staff was always very friendly. The lobby is so elegant and the rooms look modern and clean. I was amazed when I walked into the room. The beds were comfortable and I slept so well. My only complaint about the room is the set up of the bathroom. The bathroom itself is great and the shower was fantastic. The door to the bathroom is a strange set up though. The door just slides over and doesn't completely close. It feels like your still in the room with other people when you're using it and if you get up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom, the light comes right through the door. This is only a minor complaint though. One of the best things about this hotel is the location. It is close to everything in the city. Some things are a longer walk, but not too bad at all. It's near public transportation, like the monorail to the Space Needle. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: chinalboo
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but wish it could have been longer. The room was fabulous, though I wish there was a lock on the sliding bathroom door. We got a steal of a deal through Priceline's "name your price" so I always worry about getting sub-par service but that couldn't be farther from the truth. Everyone from the valet to the concierge was very friendly and helpful. I was surprised to find a steam room and sauna in the ladie's locker room by the pool. All the facilities were exquisite. We did not have a chance to try the restaurant or coffee bar due to time limitations. I would definitley recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: PQBrown
Reviews.Content: We went to Seattle for a short trip; just enough to enjoy downtown and take in an evening show at Jazz Alley. The entire experience at the Hyatt was what we had come to expect. The service; the cleanliness; the staff; the room; the comfort. Everything about the Hyatt enhanced our stay. I wholeheartedly recommend this wonderful hotel to anyone thinking of staying in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly excellent”
Reviews.Author: roboird
Reviews.Content: Ridiculously friendly and helpful staff. Really top notch. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Minor problem of sounds from adjacent room. My biggest issue was the internet service. I was told I could have an ethernet connection for free with the group rate I was on, but I never could get the thing to connect. In all fairness, I never raised this with the hotel, but just opted for the paid wireless with t-mobile. The t-mobile hotspot at 9.99 per day was rather problematic to get connected and was not all that fast considering I was paying. The flip side is that there is a Starbuck's or Barnes and Noble each one block away with fast and free internet. The hotel is located in what appears to be the heart of the downtown area, adjacent to trains/tubes or whatever there is in Seattle. A reasonably priced hotel restaurant with good food is attached. If I were staying in the downtown area again, I would book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Water”
Reviews.Author: edsh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Great service. Comfortable bed and clean room But the shower - omg - in their effort to maintain environmental certification, the water is turned down to one quarter strength. The shower head mixes air with water trying to simulate pressure while conserving water. The result is a shower where you barely get wet. Hope they do something to fix this. If you are a Hyatt Diamond member, you get a breakfast voucher for use in the restaurant. Use it for an exceptional meal.

Reviews.Title: “A solid choice.”
Reviews.Author: no1saluki
Reviews.Content: Ok, well let's start with some of the minor irritations. Is room 1767 a conference room? Boy the new occupants in that room were loud and since my room is an adjoining room, I could hear everything-- echos and all. The walls appear to be paper thin. I get earth friendliness of this hotel and I comment Hyatt for this initiative. I just wish the shower head had a bit more gusto. I had one of those open showers so of course, the precious steam blew away while in-shower. The shower control was very finicky, too, which required precision manipulation to get hot water to disburse. A hair too high or too low on the dial and I was feeling the frigid water. Rooms were tastefully decorated and appointed. The bed was heaven! And, for a standard room, the size was generous. The entire property looks to be well maintained as if it opened yesterday. I also like the built-in iPod/iPhone charge dock on the alarm clock. No need to pull out my charger during this stay. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Overall this was a great choice other than the loud neighbors/paper-thin walls and the finicky open shower.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: BusinessOrPleasure96
Reviews.Content: A modern, comfortable and very pleasant place to stay. Very nice indoor pool and hot tub. Rooms are reasonably spacious and particularly well-equipped. Our 14th floor room wasalso very quiet. I previously stayed here right after opening two years ago and it still appears brand new. A tough choice between this and the Grand Hyatt a block away. If I could get it on a Priceline bid, it would be just about perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room/View, wonderful amenities”
Reviews.Author: hapasmurf
Reviews.Content: The location is in a great spot in Seattle close to downtown and capitol hill. When we arrived they had informed us we'd been upgraded to a suite so my review is based on that. the suite was Enormous! it was practially the length of a bowling alley with a great view of the city. the room was extremely clean, and i loved the TV built into the mirror. would definitely stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “THE OLIVE 8 IS GREAT”
Reviews.Author: mlenio11
Reviews.Content: I went to Seattle on business and stayed at the Olive 8... It was outstanding! It's conveniently located right downtown in walking distance of nearly everything. The check-in process was quick and easy, and the room was great. Nearby, you can find shopping, nightlife, bars, etc. The hotel was clean, well kept, and the customer service was great. I would definitely stay here again if I had the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: WOW -- this hotel is gorgeous. The public spaces are stunning -- very modern with fantastic fixtures and great design. Sometimes modern hotels can feel cheap, but this one did not -- everything was very elegant and high-end. My room was also very nice -- modern decor, roomy bathroom, great bed, nice desk, etc. I was very, very impressed. The service at the hotel was also excellent. The person who checked me in was extremely friendly and welcoming. The valet service was polite and had my car ready to go very quickly. I was stunned by the quality of the fitness center -- nicer than the gym I have a membership to at home! Absolutely huge with a FULL range of cardio and weight-based equipment. There's a separate studio that has some classes and, when classes aren't in session, can be used for jump rope, etc. It's always great when the quality of a hotel's gym motivates you to work out! Fantastic location, too -- right in downtown Seattle. Great restaurants, excellent shopping, etc. is all within walking distance of the hotel. This is one of those places where you hated to stay just one night.

Reviews.Title: “My second home in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: PublicRelAsian
Reviews.Content: I travel to Seattle on average 1-2 a month and always spend at least one night at Olive 8. It's clean, beautifully decorated and the location and service is absolutely top notch. The hotel's best available rates can be slightly pricey but there's good deals to be had if you watch their promotions carefully. I always take up on the eStandby offer of a 60 minute massage at the Elaia Spa for $79. The massage is other-worldly and the spa facilities -- including his-and-hers private steam room and sauna in change rooms, an indoor salt water pool and a large hot tub, which are available to hotel guests as well -- are well-maintained and provide a welcome respite to the cold, rainy Seattle winter days. Granted, sometimes the pool can be a bit rowdy with kids splashing around, but catching it at the right time, you could have one of the most peaceful, relaxing time at this pool. I have found staff at both the hotel and at the spa to be extremely courteous, warm and professional, which further enhances the infrastructure of the hotel, which, incidentally, is LEED certified -- you'd never notice the difference in terms of comfort as I've had some of my best sleeps here. A couple of features at Olive 8 that subtly signals to me that the hotel management actually thinks about and cares about what travellers actually want: - there is a fridge -- not a mini-bar, but a fridge -- in each room. - there is an A/V input panel on the work desk that is integrated into the large flat screen TV, including PC, component and HDMI input -- enabling you to play your own music, movies or presentations in the room and the integration is seamless. The hotel also has a 24hr fitness center with great equipment. My only quib is that the lighting is very low and with dark floor, it's sometimes hard to see -- not a good combination when you're lifting weights. For all of these reasons, I highly recommend a visit to the Hyatt at Olive 8. Oh, don't forget to try the skinny fries at the hotel restaurant, Urbane, which has great happy hours from 3-6p and after 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but avoid rooms near icemakers!!!”
Reviews.Author: SeaGre
Reviews.Content: Really wanted to love this hotel because it has lots going for it, but we slipped away for a night only to be stuck in a room near an icemaker. Never has an icemaker been a problem for us before, but in this case it was right across the hall and sounded like a freight train. Woke us 4 times. Called front desk at 4 am to find out if it was broken. Was told "no" this was just "normal". On checkout next day staff was mildly apologetic. We'll "mark your record" to be away from ice machine next time--like we won't remember. Overall, nice hotel, but avoid rooms near ice machine like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute reservation thru priceline! And it was great...”
Reviews.Author: leesh
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel at the last minute in Seattle and used priceline.. We were thrilled with our experience.. Beautiful room and lobby, good location and great beds! Slept soundly! Try Ruth chris's Steakhouse for happy hour... Just across the street! We would go back...

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: kroberts5182
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Olive 8 over Valentine's Weekend. From the moment we drove in , to the moment we left, the staff was excellent. Had a wonderful dinner at Urbane, where the experience coxntinued to be great. Will go back again.....and encourage people going to Seattle highly consider the Olive 8.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown location, nice gym and relaxing pool.”
Reviews.Author: LivetoTravel1066
Reviews.Content: I travelled as the leisure guest on my husband's business trip. This hotel location was the perfect for both of us. It was close to his business meetings, and for me the hotel offered a great mini-vacation. They have a very good restaurant on-site and I could also walk within a few blocks to Nordstrom and Macy's and Barnes and Noble. They have a spa, which I did not try; but the gym was very large with all the full machines that you would find in a professional gym at home. The full size pool was a welcome relaxing treat with comfortable cushioned lounge chairs and relaxing, quiet music. It had floor to ceiling windows that I could see the sunny (that day) skies overhead. I was very relaxed after a fun day of sight-seeing and shopping. My only complaint was the beds were too hard, I don't know if they have better beds in an upgraded room, but if they do I would request it next time. We will stay here again and I recommend it if your travel plans bring you to this downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Arielarafe
Reviews.Content: It was my 1st time in Seattle and even though we rushed in and out of this hotel as we were in tight schedules, I had an amazing time from checking in to sleep quality, amenities, bell hop services and checking out, I couldn't ask for anything more especially the well lit hallway. We arrived into the hotel late into the night and literally took 5 minutes and they immediately sent our luggage for us the next minute since we were so tired and ready to crash. Everything in the room is perfect since from the cleaniness to the bathroom. The amenities in the bathroom were perfect from towels to shampoo and I immediately felt asleep in the most comfortable bed after taking the well pressured hot shower. The staffs in the hotel is most certainly very helpful in every way they could and very accommodating in every way they can from retrieving our car to checking local information for us. I wished I had the time to stay a little longer had we not been in a tight schedule. I never thought Hyatt provide this kind of amazing service and made me think twice (in a good way) in staying when booking a Hyatt again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: norwaytravler
Reviews.Content: Lovley hotel, GREAT spa-area and pool, clean and big rooms,super nice staff, super breakfast resurant- we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love this property!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalGal41
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful and they have thought of everything for amenities! The rain shower was fabulous and the beds so comfortable that if there weren't so many sights to see in Seattle, I would have stayed in it all day! The staff was engaging and helpful and the restaurant was lounge was fabulous! We enjoyed a delicious flatbread and creative drinks in the lounge. The next night, we ordered in-room dining options. I highly recommend the Mac & Cheese, the BLT as well as the Sliders!

Reviews.Title: “A unique and worthy hotel property in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: tmc0084
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late on this review - I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend back in June 2010 - but I was impressed with the hotel. The overall decor of the hotel was very eye-popping. We were warmly greeted at the front desk. I appreciate it when they address you by name, it adds a personal touch. The king room was spacious and clean, and we had a nice view of the green roof and the theatre nearby. The bathroom was the cleanest I've ever been in. The spa was a great experience. We got a couples massage and were treated very well by the staff. I've read other reviews that said the walls were thin. We didn't have any problems with noise, but we were in a corner unit, and there may not have been a lot of people on our floor, so I can't really vouch either way. We had breakfast at Urbana one day, and the food was very good, but pricey. I tend to stay away from hotel restaurants, but we were being lazy that morning. To be nitpicky, my only issue was the $10 Internet charge. Hotels need to get into the 21st century mindset that it should be complimentary to all. Why can Hilton Garden Inns offer it and not this one? Overall, this is one of the nicest hotels I've ever visited, and it's in a city that I fell in love with, so there is a good bet that I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek & Modern, LOVE LOVE this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: baby888
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt at Olive 8 for 2 nights, family of 5 with 3 teen boys. We booked 2 connecting rooms (1 king, 2 queens). Very modern and clean hotel, very friendly valet and check-in service. Spacious rooms, comfortable beds, spacious bathrooms. Ordered room service twice, very good food and service. Nice gym and lap pool. Will definitely try the hotel spa next time. The only thing I found to be missing is a soda machine, but not timportant overall. Quiet room, didn't hear any other guests. Great location to the wonderful downtown shopping, coffee places, restaurants, very safe location. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Seattle, this hotel is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet, handy to shops and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: 234rhc
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the cleanliness of the spacious room and bathroom. Lots of drawers and good closet space. The bed was extremely comfortable with extra pillows. We were able to use our computer thanks to the cable provided at no charge by the front desk. We enjoyed everything we tried at the hotel and we will be back. Thanks HYATT!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - look forward to staying again”
Reviews.Author: pacersguy31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Olive 8 for a weekend - great stay! I've traveled quite extensively and have stayed at nice hotels in major metros - We arrived early - too early for check in - and left our bags with concierge at the check in desk. Not a problem, concierge brougth them to our room upon checkin - very attentive front desk and service staff. This hotel is LEDD cert - ultra-modern and cutting edge decor. We do regret having not eated at the restaurant on site, which is known to be one of Seattle's best dining experiences Rooms are large and the view was great - right downtown. Only a 15 minute walk to Pike's Market - Clean rooms, nice size, marble bathrooms, oversized shower that was spotless/clean - everything was excellent. My wife and I look forward to staying here again on our next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Hyatt Olive 8”
Reviews.Author: villasequim
Reviews.Content: From the front desk to the restaurant, everyone we met was helpful, friendly and engaging. We thought the rooms were amazing. Good sized rooms with great bedding, comfortable chairs, nice lighting, great coffee maker, wonderful computer station and ipod docking station, great big windows, good sized bathroom and on and on and on.... We LOVED the frosted bathroom door in the corner king room. Urbane has a nice happy hour and a wonderful breakfast !! We will definitely be back and will share our experience with all of our friends...

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: seattlejd
Reviews.Content: Went with 3 girlfriends to Seattle for an overnight - shopping, Christmas lights, food. Everything at the Olive 8 was a great experience, from the moment we checked in to the time we left. Joey at the front desk worked with us to get adjoining rooms and even sent up wine and chocolates later that night! The entire staff was friendly, the rooms were awesome, the pool, sauna, steam room and work out facilities were sumptuous. Everything in the room was top notch - beds, linens, blow dryer, products, etc. Location is great too - close to top restaurants, shopping, bus stop, Pike's Market. We are all ready to return and stay more than 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraLatte
Reviews.Content: I booked a Premier Queen room (which has two queen beds) for a Saturday night stay. I have stayed at my fair share of downtown Seattle business hotels, and they are more or less about the same--except for this Hyatt. I was impressed. First of all, the room was advertised as 740 square feet, and indeed it was the most spacious hotel room I've been in outside of suites in Las Vegas. Beautiful corner location with rows and rows of windows, bringing in lots of natural light. Nice flat-screen TV and clean-as-a-whistle bathroom. Some trouble with noise from our next-door neighbors, but that's to be expected. We had trouble with the room temperature, which got very cold and very hot when you turned the fan on, but somehow couldn't get "just right." Maybe a quirk of the "green" certification? Service was prompt and extremely friendly, and when I called down for extra shampoo it came within a half hour. I was also impressed by the call to the room from the gal who checked me in, just to make sure we had everything. Our room was on the 4th floor, so the view wasn't as sweeping as advertised on the corporate website. If you are paying full price and want a view, request a high floor. Valet parking was a breeze, and, sadly, $39 is the norm for downtown Seattle. I've waited for my car for a half hour at other hotels on Sunday check-outs, but they had my car within 2 minutes. We had breakfast at the lobby restaurant, and that was the only disappointment. Food was overpriced and overcooked, and service was very slow with 3/4 of the tables full. Many patrons seemed to have free breakfast coupons. If you don't have a coupon, skip it.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jstm58
Reviews.Content: We had a super fun weekend at this hotel for our 25th wedding anniversary. This hotel has it all. The gorgeous spa provided a couple's massage that was so relaxing with expertly-trained therapists. The hotel staff was friendly and efficient and their enthusiasm for our anniversary really added to our celebration. They made us feel so special. Our room was elegant and furnished with everything we could possibly need especially the comfy beds. The fitness center is state of the art and the 60ft saline lap pool made us feel that we were lounging by a tropical pool. The location is great. This is the place to make a memory.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: rombuk74
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to stay here at a discounted rate through Priceline. This hotel has a great location in downtwon Seattle. It has modern furniture and excellent fitness center and swimming pool. We had one unfortunate incident when we checked in. We discovered unclean pillows on our bed. I assume this was a rare finding in such a upscale hotel. After our complaint, they changed our room. However, we did not receive any other compensation for inconvenience. The hotel also does not have free Internet. In these days and times, you expect to find free Internet everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Put a business client up here for a few days”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior2010_10
Reviews.Content: and I was extremely impressed........which is really hard to do. Almost new, there is not a spot on the place. The suite I booked was large and he reported that the bed was the perfect mix of soft and firm. We had coffee and meetings in the suite the first day and everyone agreed that it is just about the nicest hotel in Seattle, edging out the Grand Hyatt across the street and the Westin in Bellevue. I would like to point out that the lovely young lady at check in was amazing and professional. I wish I had been professional enough to remember her name. The rate was fair for an end week large suite. Thank you for helping me make a good impression.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet spot”
Reviews.Author: George_PConnecticut
Reviews.Content: The perfect time to stay in a hotel is probably when it is still very new but has had time to work out the kinks. That sweet spot is what youâ€™ll find at Hyatt at Olive 8. The common areas are very modern and appealing. The restaurant and bar is beautiful; and the fitness center is very large and one of the best Iâ€™ve seen. The location is greatâ€”itâ€™s definitely worth your while to walk from the hotel, along the vibrant Pine Street shopping district down to Pike Place Market and Belltown. I appreciated the fact that the concierge had made loaner umbrellas available. Their commitment to sustainability neither enhanced nor detracted from our visit; but guests for whom this is a deal-breaker will be happy here. The rooms were OK. Where we were situated, we opened the door and Boom, thereâ€™s the room (i.e. no entry hallway). It made us feel very much on top of the activity in the hallway because, as others have mentioned, the soundproofing isnâ€™t great. Our view was of an office building that appeared to be very close, but I understand that in an urban area, sometime that canâ€™t be helped. Charging for high-speed internet is pretty lousy, though. Even worse, the cost is per device, so if one of you has an iPad and the other has a laptop, count on shelling out twenty bucks. If it were a decision between the two, Iâ€™d rather the hotel skip leaving a Seattle Times outside everyoneâ€™s door, especially as another nod to being environmentally friendly. I did get a great rate, which included valet parking and a gift card. So, all things considered, I would stay there again and Iâ€™d recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: EricC01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hyatt at Olive 8 for 4 nights in October. The taxi from the airport dropped us at the door, where our bags were taken straight to my room by the Concierge - Earl. The room was large, clean and modern and the beds extremely comfortable. I had a high floor room which let in plenty of natural light - and it was also quiet. The pool was fantastic! Spacious pool and surround with plenty of loungers. The Jacuzzi was also a good size and changing facilities were excellent. Oh, and it had a brilliant steam room and sauna!! Breakfast in 'Urbane' was nice and of good quality, however, i wouldn't return for an evening meal as the quality certainly didn't match that of breakfast. The evening meal was returned untouched - and nobody asked why! An error at checkout left me to pay for an upgrded room that i had not experienced, but this was quickly rectified and my bill altered by an extremely apologetic staff member. I shall leave my review with a positive - Earl the concierge. This guy was excellent, helpful, well informed of Seattle and always had a smile. I will stay in the Olive if i return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown area”
Reviews.Author: odaat56
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, within walking distance of Pike's Place and other downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Was prepared to be impressed...but wasn't!!”
Reviews.Author: pjfeifer
Reviews.Content: Had issues at check-in. Staff tried to tell us that 4 people can sleep in a King room. I confirmed in April by phone and email that I had a room for 4. Room is not convention friendly. The only mirror was in the bathroom. Bathroom door has a frosted glass panel in it. You could land an airplane using the light around the mirror. Made it difficult to sleep, if someone had to use it during the night. Morning #1: alarm went off --it was left on from the person before us. Morning #2: We received a wake up call we didn't ask for. Morning #3: Maid knocked on the door around 8am. We were there 7 nights and had to call everyday for 2 extra sets of towels. Shower had a small basket to hold soap, could not fit much in it so we had to put stuff on the ground. Bathroom needed another towel bar. Room did not have many drawers to hold clothes. When we tried to use the blow dryer in the room so someone else could shower a fuse kept blowing. For a green hotel, they had the heat blasting in public areas. The locker room, pool & hot tub were nice. It would have been helpful if the hotel posted how to get a key for the locker in the locker room. Did find the front desk associates particularly friendly. Concierge Earl was awesome. Valets were great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bluehills68
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in this hotel and found it to be great. The staff were great - nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were lovely, very clean and very very comfortable. The attention to detail with the toiletries in the spa changing rooms were incredible - I have never seen that level before and I have stayed in a few top class hotels in the world. So, if you can afford it, go for it - it's worth it. p.s. The last Hyatt I stayed in was Birmingham, England and it was excellent too - so I'm now going to seek out Hyatts first before any other hotel group

Reviews.Title: “Eco-concious, Quality, Quality, Superb Location, Staff & Price, Strange Billing Mishaps, which got remedied”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustak
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed her on October 10th, checking out on October 11th, 2010. This is an excellent hotel. Minimalistic lobby, in a hip, eco-conscious sort of way. The staff here are excellent. It is probably the best service I have ever experienced. I am sensitive to chemicals from work-related chemical exposures, and the WA Toxic Coalition recommended this hotel, saying it is one of 3 hotels in the Pacific NW that is eco-friendly. From the minute I called, to the minute I checked out, and then afterwards, dealing with billing mishaps, the staff were superb. I saw one website that this hotel only used non-chemical cleaners in their rooms. When I double checked, the front desk person checked with the housekeeping staff, and unfortunately they did use regular cleaning products; but when I asked if the room could be prepared in a special way, they happily said that it could. I prefer to book reservations on-line. (I.e. no mishaps in name, billing address, etc. plus, I get a chance to pick the room. And now, since becoming sensitive to cleaning products, I could type in comments with the way I could ask the room to be prepared.) After I made the reservation, I called the hotel back and the front desk person also made a special note about how the room would be prepared. I have literally never received such excellent service as I did from this hotel, except at the Nile Cairo; but even so, this hotel exceeded that one in service, and just about everything else, for that matter. At any rate, my mom and I showed up, and just to make sure, we inquired if the room was indeed prepared the way we asked. (It is a pain being sensitive to chemicals, which I only just acquired recently, but I so appreciated this hotel in accommodating me with this.) The front desk clerk checked with housekeeping, and then double checked with the manager. I couldn't believe the service we received. She said the room had not been shampooed and the sheets had been washed in baking soda, and I believe the bathroom was cleaned the same way, as I had asked. Again, the service was outstanding. You would think that you would only get this type of service if you were the president or staying at a $400-$500 room or something. And, they did so, so happily, like they were really happy to see you, and serve you. Amazing. I've never really received service like that before. Thus, we go up to the room and it was lovely. Very cool and hip furnishings. Big, flat screen TV. We might sound like "hicks," ha, ha, but we've never watched TV on an HDTV before. Of course friends have told us about it. And, we must be behind the times, as we laughed and giggled at the quality of it. We were watching something on the Discovery channel, underwater something or another, and we honestly couldn't tell if it was a cartoon or not! It was that good. The rest of the room had excellent quality everything. There were two comfortable queen beds. Lovely crisp white cotton duvets with pretty bedspreads folded at the bottom of the bed. I believe down pillows. A hip cool chair with an end table. Picture windows with nice views of downtown Seattle. I wished the windows would have opened, but they didn't. They did, it seemed, have some sort of fresh air that came in through the vents, though. The bathroom was nice. Like what you would see on the House Hunters show. Very hip and cool, too. One of those sliding opaque, semi-see-through doors. Marble, I believe, floors, and vanity with the sink. A low flow toilet, which went along with the eco-minded theme of the hotel. A large tub, which I wished I could have soaked in, but in the interest of time, I didn't. The hair dryer was very nice. High powered, but not very loud. A rubber handle, which felt nice on the hands. A very nice, one-pot coffee pot. I wish I could have bought the hairdryer and coffee pot from the Hyatt catalog. The rooom was so nice and we were only there one night, it was like, "what to do? what to do? Soak in the tub, eat room service, watch the nice TV, or go to the spa?" which by the way was nice, too. They had a steam room and a sauna, with their nice thick Hyatt towels and bathrobes. I skipped the sauna and we ate room service, twice. Equally excellent. Very nice quality. Nice wait staff. The prices were excellent. We're used to paying, I guess high prices up here. We don't really think they are high. We're just used to it, then getting semi-mediocore food. But when you go down to the lower 48, or in particular this hotel, and get the food you do, for the prices quoted, you're impressed. (However, I was just in upstate NY, MD, PA, and Pasadena, CA in April and May, and got sort of high priced food that was mediocore, so this hotel really stood out.) The food came and we were "wowed." The servers brought it on a lovely pewter tray, with lovely heavy silverware and pewter salt and pepper shakers. We had the open faced steak sandwich and fish and chips for dinner. Excellent. For breakfast we had the eggs benedict and the florentine scramble. Very good waitstaff and food. It was a little weird, though, when the food arrived for breakfast the waiter said, "no toast, just as you ordered," which I didn't say "no toast" on the phone, which was strange, but no matter.
